name: Lyngen Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended by a friend but still exceeded all my expectations, great food and a real home from home personal experience with friendly attentive staff. The big attraction was to see the midnight sun for me at 1am! The scenery combination of mountains and sea together is quite incredible. Lots of activities too, recommend the sea safari (touching the ice walls from the boat is a must do!) and the deep sea fishing, mountain trekking and the massive waterfalls on the Reisa River. This is undoubtably one of the world's most beautiful places and the lodge fits right in. The only bad thing is that we had to leave!!! We’ll be back… in winter for the northern lights!
reviews.title: fantastic experience

reviews.text: It was our first visit this far North in Norway. The first impressions of the all white Lyngen Alps with its always changing coloured fjords is hard to comprehend. I think I have skied in many scenic places, but this one was defnitely the most special and magical place I have been to. It is SO quiet, the mountains are waiting for you to explore them one more prettier than the other.
reviews.title: exceptional scenic skiing, great service, GO!

reviews.text: In this amazing scenery we were so happy to find a lodge, which exceeded our wildest dreams. The lodge is built in a very classy way, all natural materials and very cosy. All luxury is there: comfi rooms with nice beds, the food is delicioius and always local, there are all kinds of cozy places to stay like the room around the fireplace with big lounge couches (with a view on the Lyngen Alps, breathtaking), the library stocked with interesting books/films about ..guess what skiing, all details are just perfect in place. But the most important thing is that the staff makes you feel very welcome, every single one of them very friendly.
reviews.title: The most fantastic week I ever spent on holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About the skiing, touring can start right behind the lodge which is such a nice feeling. The terrain is interesting and there are loads of possibilities, but ofcrouse you need to skin up all by yourself, I found it so rewarding, it is very very special.
reviews.title: way overrated

reviews.text: Anyway, this is a plce you shoudl see and if you go simply stay at Lyngenlodge, you will not regret it, promiss!!!
reviews.title: Very risky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our experience at Lyngen Lodge was outstanding. Service and food were excellent. The staff, all english speaking and mostly but not all from the UK, were friendly, helpful, and enthusiastic.
reviews.title: Gorgeous in winter

reviews.text: The lodge was built about 2 years ago and the interior design, furnishings, and style are models of casual elegance. Dining, as in many B&B style lodges, is at a single great table. This worked well to introduce us to Norwegian, Swedish, Swiss, and British guests, many of whom came to climb and ski the Lyngen Alps.
reviews.title: An out of world, magical experience- absolutely phenominal

reviews.text: The lodge deserves 5 stars and a Michelin plaque. The hospitality provided by the entire staff is fantastic. The location is great with plenty of hikes, boat trips and time to unwind. The lodge is relaxing with a great view of the mountains and water. But to top it off the cooking skills of Elisabeth and Kevin are of the highest quality. The co owner Graham is also a great adventure junkie and host providing great tips, including the best fishing spots - we caught two nice cod fish. The rooms are small, but the bed is comfortable and nicely designed. Wifi is also super fast.
reviews.title: The only things missing are the stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I spent 3 wonderful nights at the Lodge. We went primarily to catch the Lights, but also got involved in the Snow Shoeing and Dog Sledding that was organised through the Lodge. Both were superb.
reviews.title: Unexpected Luxury

reviews.text: Tom was our guide for the walking and was fantastic. Massively enthusiastic and providing a relaxed atmosphere.
reviews.title: Lyngen Lodge

reviews.text: That is a key to Lyngen Lodge. You can do as little or as much as you like, though I recommend the latter. The Lodge itself just exudes relaxation. We spent time down in the sharing rooms, by the fire, either reading,or in the case of my better half, snoozing on the sofa.
reviews.title: above & beyond perfection

reviews.text: The food was wonderful, and well above any of my expectations.
reviews.title: As close to paradise as it gets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed during the middle of summer, as this is a primo ski destination, summer is considered the off season. The only staff was a British couple that seemed to be having the time of their lives filling in for the owners and regular staff. The food was tops, and they were helpful with helping us plan our little trip to Nordreise National Park. It was a perfect weekend getaway for us. Great location, great service, new structure and well designed little lodge.
reviews.title: Fun in the off season

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the lodge over the new year. Although the trip from and to Tromso will take you 2-3 hours, it is absolutely worth it given the amazing experience that anyone can have. Elizabeth, Katja and all the staff were super helpful, kind and trying to make the best of our time there. We had a private cook for the 2 days, with superb and innovative menus, delicious food. The lodge is very cozy and designed in a perfect Scandinavian way, which makes you feel at home after a few hours in the cold outside. The outdoor jacuzzi will allow you to experience the Scandinavian tradition of taking hot bath in minus temperatures. A delight for the body and mind, which you can complete with some time in the sauna. The rooms might be a bit small but that will not matter too much given that you will spend most of the time in the common areas of the lodge and outside. Everything is neat, clean with a good feeling of new.
reviews.title: Top end experience in the remote wilderness of Norway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Tromso for the northern lights and if you are interested, the lodge is a place you can see them well, as it is far from any light pollution. You can see the picture attached which we took on the night of the 30 December.
reviews.title: romantic honeymoon, stunning setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to spend some splurge time with your companion of family, we strongly suggest the Lyngen Lodge to do so.
reviews.title: Even better than expected!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights on our honeymoon in June and had an amazing experience. The real point of the lodge is ski touring, which I can't comment on. But the scenery, service, food and design were all excellent - beyond our expectations. The setting is incredible, and although the lodge is right off a major road (you can't tell this from the pictures) it still feels remote. There's not really any traffic - you are pretty far removed here. The views from the dining area and living room are simply breathtaking. The staff was incredibly sweet and welcoming, and for two of the nights we were there we were the only guests and had a private chef! (That would never happen in season, I'm sure!) The meals were inventive and delicious, and without a doubt the best food we had in Norway. Thanks, Steve!! Mid-June is a bit of a tricky time to visit this part of Norway, and the Glacier Walk we had booked was cancelled since it was still too dangerous. The lodge staff did their best to advise us of options for day hikes, but weren't as well informed as I would have expected, and the owners were absent. If you are traveling here in the summer and want to hike on your own, I would recommend coming prepared with proper maps. The rooms are small and cozy, but the decor throughout is exceptionally well done. It is a really special place, and I would recommend it without reservation.
reviews.title: One of the best family holidays ever. We hope to return

description: Norwegian Timber Lodge offering full board and B&B luxury accommodation with spectacular views over the Lyngen Alps and Lyngen fjord providing a perfect base for relaxation and guided adventures high above the Arctic Circle.
